meanings.definition: Cause to act dishonestly for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The temptation of money is corrupting him.
meanings.sent2: The corrupting influence of power can lead people astray.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the cookie jar was corrupting him with its sweet treats.
meanings.sent4: The allure of fame was corrupting her sense of self.
meanings.sent5: The corrupting nature of greed can consume a person entirely.

meanings.sent1: The evil villain was corrupting the innocent minds of the youth.
meanings.sent2: Corrupting someone's morals can have lasting consequences.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to be corrupting the dog's behavior.
meanings.sent4: The darkness in his heart was corrupting his once pure intentions.
meanings.sent5: The corrupting influence of hatred can poison even the kindest soul.

meanings.sent1: The virus was corrupting the computer's files.
meanings.sent2: Time can be corrupting, changing memories over the years.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was corrupting the game rules to win.
meanings.sent4: The artist's unique style was corrupting the traditional painting techniques.
meanings.sent5: The corrupting effects of weather can erode even the strongest structures.
